Key Match Events: India won by 4 wickets (with 0 balls remaining).
Hardik Pandya scored 40 runs off 37 balls.
Dinesh Karthik was stumped by Mohammad Rizwan off Mohammad Nawaz for 1 run.
Pre-Game Insights: Experts highlighted the clash of philosophies between the two teams, with India having a formidable batting unit and Pakistan boasting a high-quality, high-pace attack.
Shaheen Shah Afridi's performance in the powerplay was identified as a key factor for Pakistan's success.
Suryakumar Yadav was noted as a crucial player for India, capable of handling both pace and spin effectively.
India needed to decide on their bowling composition, particularly whether to include R Ashwin against Pakistan's right-hand-heavy lineup.
Pakistan had to choose three out of their five fast-bowling options, with Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf being certainties.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG) with a capacity of over 100,000 spectators.
There were concerns about rain affecting the match, but it proceeded as planned.
The toss was considered less crucial at the MCG, with a 50% win record for chasing teams since 2020.
